io

Class FileInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.FileInput

  • public class FileInput
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for reading bytes from the source file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileInput(InStream in)
      Initializes the InStream.
      FileInput(java.lang.String sourcePath)
      Default constructor that initializes an InputByteStream.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void advanceToNextByte()
      If currently in the middle of a byte, advance to the beginning of the next byte, and don't read the rest of the current byte.
      void close()
      Closes the input.
      int readBit()
      Reads one bit from the current byte.
      int readByte()
      Reads the next byte.
      int readNumberOfBits(int length) 
      void resetToBeginning()
      Resets the input to the beginning, so that the next byte read will be the first byte of the file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileInput

        public FileInput(java.lang.String sourcePath)
        Default constructor that initializes an InputByteStream.
        Parameters:
        sourcePath - path of the file to read

      • FileInput

        public FileInput(InStream in)
        Initializes the InStream.
        Parameters:
        in - reads the file

    • Method Detail

      • readByte

        public int readByte()
        Reads the next byte.
        Returns:
        the next byte or -1 if the file has ended or could not be read

      • readBit

        public int readBit()
        Reads one bit from the current byte. If the end of the byte is reached, a new byte is read into memory.
        Returns:
        the next bit

      • readNumberOfBits

        public int readNumberOfBits(int length)

      • advanceToNextByte

        public void advanceToNextByte()
        If currently in the middle of a byte, advance to the beginning of the next byte, and don't read the rest of the current byte.

      • resetToBeginning

        public void resetToBeginning()
        Resets the input to the beginning, so that the next byte read will be the first byte of the file.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the input.
